From my understanding, a big difference between a religious/private school and a secular/public school is going to be the price tag. Since public universities receive funds from the state, their tuition rates are much lower. Private schools have higher tuition rates, but generally there are many more scholarships available that offset the price making it more comparable to a public school.
 
 There is also probably going to be subtle differences in housing arrangements, activities, the surrounding community, & expectations of students (which may include religion classes).
